metadata.title: MCP Server Catalog
metadata.description: קובץ קטלוג מרכזי המכיל שרתי MCP וכלים (tools) שמותאמים לשימוש על ידי סוכני MCP.
metadata.purpose: לתעד את כלי ה-MCP הזמינים, כולל תבניות קלט (inputSchema) לכל כלי, כדי לאפשר ולוודא קריאה/שילוב אוטומטי מצד לקוחות וסוכנים.

tools.name: initialize_project
tools.description: Initializes a new Task Master project structure by calling the core initialization logic. Creates necessary folders and configuration files for Task Master in the current directory.

tools.name: models
tools.description: Get information about available AI models or set model configurations. Run without arguments to get the current model configuration and API key status for the selected model providers.

tools.name: rules
tools.description: Add or remove rule profiles from the project.

tools.name: parse_prd
tools.description: Parse a Product Requirements Document (PRD) text file to automatically generate initial tasks. Reinitializing the project is not necessary to run this tool. It is recommended to run parse-prd after initializing the project and creating/importing a prd.txt file in the project root's .taskmaster/docs directory.

tools.name: response-language
tools.description: Get or set the response language for the project

tools.name: analyze_project_complexity
tools.description: Analyze task complexity and generate expansion recommendations.

tools.name: expand_task
tools.description: Expand a task into subtasks for detailed implementation

tools.name: expand_all
tools.description: Expand all pending tasks into subtasks based on complexity or defaults

tools.name: scope_up_task
tools.description: Increase the complexity of one or more tasks using AI

tools.name: scope_down_task
tools.description: Decrease the complexity of one or more tasks using AI

tools.name: get_tasks
tools.description: Get all tasks from Task Master, optionally filtering by status and including subtasks.

tools.name: get_task
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific task

tools.name: next_task
tools.description: Find the next task to work on based on dependencies and status

tools.name: complexity_report
tools.description: Display the complexity analysis report in a readable format

tools.name: set_task_status
tools.description: Set the status of one or more tasks or subtasks.

tools.name: generate
tools.description: Generates individual task files in tasks/ directory based on tasks.json

tools.name: add_task
tools.description: Add a new task using AI

tools.name: add_subtask
tools.description: Add a subtask to an existing task

tools.name: update
tools.description: Update multiple upcoming tasks (with ID >= 'from' ID) based on new context or changes provided in the prompt. Use 'update_task' instead for a single specific task or 'update_subtask' for subtasks.

tools.name: update_task
tools.description: Updates a single task by ID with new information or context provided in the prompt.

tools.name: update_subtask
tools.description: Appends timestamped information to a specific subtask without replacing existing content. If you just want to update the subtask status, use set_task_status instead.

tools.name: remove_task
tools.description: Remove a task or subtask permanently from the tasks list

tools.name: remove_subtask
tools.description: Remove a subtask from its parent task

tools.name: clear_subtasks
tools.description: Clear subtasks from specified tasks

tools.name: move_task
tools.description: Move a task or subtask to a new position

tools.name: add_dependency
tools.description: Add a dependency relationship between two tasks

tools.name: remove_dependency
tools.description: Remove a dependency from a task

tools.name: validate_dependencies
tools.description: Check tasks for dependency issues (like circular references or links to non-existent tasks) without making changes.

tools.name: fix_dependencies
tools.description: Fix invalid dependencies in tasks automatically

tools.name: list_tags
tools.description: List all available tags with task counts and metadata

tools.name: add_tag
tools.description: Create a new tag for organizing tasks in different contexts

tools.name: delete_tag
tools.description: Delete an existing tag and all its tasks

tools.name: use_tag
tools.description: Switch to a different tag context for task operations

tools.name: rename_tag
tools.description: Rename an existing tag

tools.name: copy_tag
tools.description: Copy an existing tag to create a new tag with all tasks and metadata

tools.name: research
tools.description: Perform AI-powered research queries with project context

tools.name: autopilot_start
tools.description: Initialize and start a new TDD workflow for a task. Creates a git branch and sets up the workflow state machine.

tools.name: autopilot_resume
tools.description: Resume a previously started TDD workflow from saved state. Restores the workflow state machine and continues from where it left off.

tools.name: autopilot_next
tools.description: Get the next action to perform in the TDD workflow. Returns detailed context about what needs to be done next, including the current phase, subtask, and expected actions.

tools.name: autopilot_status
tools.description: Get comprehensive workflow status including current phase, progress, subtask details, and activity history.

tools.name: autopilot_complete_phase
tools.description: Complete the current TDD phase (RED, GREEN, or COMMIT) with test result validation. RED phase: expects failures (if 0 failures, feature is already implemented and subtask auto-completes). GREEN phase: expects all tests passing.

tools.name: autopilot_commit
tools.description: Create a git commit with automatic staging, message generation, and metadata embedding. Generates appropriate commit messages based on subtask context and TDD phase.

tools.name: autopilot_finalize
tools.description: Finalize and complete the workflow. Validates that all changes are committed and working tree is clean before marking workflow as complete.

tools.name: autopilot_abort
tools.description: Abort the current TDD workflow and clean up workflow state. This will remove the workflow state file but will NOT delete the git branch or any code changes.

tools.name: load_collection
tools.title: Loads a collection by id
tools.description: Loads a collection by id from the metadata and returns its object representation.

tools.name: list_collections
tools.title: Lists available collections
tools.description: Lists all collections available in the repository metadata.

tools.name: load_instruction
tools.title: Loads a custom instruction or agent
tools.description: Loads a custom instruction or agent from the repository.

filename.description: The filename of the instruction or agent

annotations.title: Loads a custom instruction or agent

tools.name: search_instructions
tools.title: Searches custom instructions and agents
tools.description: Searches custom instructions and agents based on keywords in their titles and descriptions.

tools.name: browser_close
tools.description: Close the page

tools.name: browser_resize
tools.description: Resize the browser window

tools.name: browser_console_messages
tools.description: Returns all console messages

tools.name: browser_handle_dialog
tools.description: Handle a dialog

promptText.description: The text of the prompt in case of a prompt dialog.

tools.name: browser_evaluate
tools.description: Evaluate JavaScript expression on page or element

function.description: () => { /* code */ } or (element) => { /* code */ } when element is provided

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

tools.name: browser_file_upload
tools.description: Upload one or multiple files

paths.description: The absolute paths to the files to upload. Can be single file or multiple files. If omitted, file chooser is cancelled.

tools.name: browser_fill_form
tools.description: Fill multiple form fields

ref.description: Exact target field reference from the page snapshot

value.description: Value to fill in the field. If the field is a checkbox, the value should be `true` or `false`. If the field is a combobox, the value should be the text of the option.

tools.name: browser_install
tools.description: Install the browser specified in the config. Call this if you get an error about the browser not being installed.

annotations.title: Install the browser specified in the config

tools.name: browser_press_key
tools.description: Press a key on the keyboard

key.description: Name of the key to press or a character to generate, such as `ArrowLeft` or `a`

tools.name: browser_type
tools.description: Type text into editable element

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

text.description: Text to type into the element

submit.description: Whether to submit entered text (press Enter after)

slowly.description: Whether to type one character at a time. Useful for triggering key handlers in the page. By default entire text is filled in at once.

tools.name: browser_navigate
tools.description: Navigate to a URL

tools.name: browser_navigate_back
tools.description: Go back to the previous page

tools.name: browser_network_requests
tools.description: Returns all network requests since loading the page

tools.name: browser_run_code
tools.description: Run Playwright code snippet

code.description: Playwright code snippet to run. The snippet should access the `page` object to interact with the page. Can make multiple statements. For example: `await page.getByRole('button', { name: 'Submit' }).click();`

tools.name: browser_take_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the current page. You can't perform actions based on the screenshot, use browser_snapshot for actions.

type.description: Image format for the screenshot. Default is png.

filename.description: File name to save the screenshot to. Defaults to `page-{timestamp}.{png|jpeg}` if not specified. Prefer relative file names to stay within the output directory.

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to screenshot the element. If not provided, the screenshot will be taken of viewport. If element is provided, ref must be provided too.

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot. If not provided, the screenshot will be taken of viewport. If ref is provided, element must be provided too.

fullPage.description: When true, takes a screenshot of the full scrollable page, instead of the currently visible viewport. Cannot be used with element screenshots.

tools.name: browser_snapshot
tools.description: Capture accessibility snapshot of the current page, this is better than screenshot

tools.name: browser_click
tools.description: Perform click on a web page

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

doubleClick.description: Whether to perform a double click instead of a single click

button.description: Button to click, defaults to left

tools.name: browser_drag
tools.description: Perform drag and drop between two elements

startElement.description: Human-readable source element description used to obtain the permission to interact with the element

startRef.description: Exact source element reference from the page snapshot

endElement.description: Human-readable target element description used to obtain the permission to interact with the element

endRef.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

tools.name: browser_hover
tools.description: Hover over element on page

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

tools.name: browser_select_option
tools.description: Select an option in a dropdown

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

values.description: Array of values to select in the dropdown. This can be a single value or multiple values.

tools.name: browser_tabs
tools.description: List, create, close, or select a browser tab.

index.description: Tab index, used for close/select. If omitted for close, current tab is closed.

tools.name: browser_wait_for
tools.description: Wait for text to appear or disappear or a specified time to pass

time.description: The time to wait in seconds

textGone.description: The text to wait for to disappear

tools.name: click
tools.description: Clicks on the provided element

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot

dblClick.description: Set to true for double clicks. Default is false.

tools.name: close_page
tools.description: Closes the page by its index. The last open page cannot be closed.

pageIdx.description: The index of the page to close. Call list_pages to list pages.

tools.name: drag
tools.description: Drag an element onto another element

from_uid.description: The uid of the element to drag

to_uid.description: The uid of the element to drop into

tools.name: emulate
tools.description: Emulates various features on the selected page.

networkConditions.description: Throttle network. Set to "No emulation" to disable. If omitted, conditions remain unchanged.

cpuThrottlingRate.description: Represents the CPU slowdown factor. Set the rate to 1 to disable throttling. If omitted, throttling remains unchanged.

tools.name: evaluate_script
tools.description:
Evaluate a JavaScript function inside the currently selected page. Returns the response as JSON
so returned values have to JSON-serializable.

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot

args.description: An optional list of arguments to pass to the function.

tools.name: fill
tools.description: Type text into a input, text area or select an option from a <select> element.

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot

tools.name: fill_form
tools.description: Fill out multiple form elements at once

uid.description: The uid of the element to fill out

elements.description: Elements from snapshot to fill out.

tools.name: get_console_message
tools.description: Gets a console message by its ID. You can get all messages by calling list_console_messages.

msgid.description: The msgid of a console message on the page from the listed console messages

tools.name: get_network_request
tools.description: Gets a network request by an optional reqid, if omitted returns the currently selected request in the DevTools Network panel.

reqid.description: The reqid of the network request. If omitted returns the currently selected request in the DevTools Network panel.

tools.name: handle_dialog
tools.description: If a browser dialog was opened, use this command to handle it

action.description: Whether to dismiss or accept the dialog

promptText.description: Optional prompt text to enter into the dialog.

tools.name: hover
tools.description: Hover over the provided element

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot

tools.name: list_console_messages
tools.description: List all console messages for the currently selected page since the last navigation.

pageSize.description: Maximum number of messages to return. When omitted, returns all requests.

pageIdx.description: Page number to return (0-based). When omitted, returns the first page.

types.description: Filter messages to only return messages of the specified resource types. When omitted or empty, returns all messages.

includePreservedMessages.description: Set to true to return the preserved messages over the last 3 navigations.

tools.name: list_network_requests
tools.description: List all requests for the currently selected page since the last navigation.

pageSize.description: Maximum number of requests to return. When omitted, returns all requests.

pageIdx.description: Page number to return (0-based). When omitted, returns the first page.

resourceTypes.description: Filter requests to only return requests of the specified resource types. When omitted or empty, returns all requests.

includePreservedRequests.description: Set to true to return the preserved requests over the last 3 navigations.

tools.name: list_pages
tools.description: Get a list of pages open in the browser.

tools.name: navigate_page
tools.description: Navigates the currently selected page to a URL.

type.description: Navigate the page by URL, back or forward in history, or reload.

ignoreCache.description: Whether to ignore cache on reload.

timeout.description: Maximum wait time in milliseconds. If set to 0, the default timeout will be used.

tools.name: new_page
tools.description: Creates a new page

url.description: URL to load in a new page.

timeout.description: Maximum wait time in milliseconds. If set to 0, the default timeout will be used.

tools.name: performance_analyze_insight
tools.description: Provides more detailed information on a specific Performance Insight of an insight set that was highlighted in the results of a trace recording.

insightSetId.description: The id for the specific insight set. Only use the ids given in the "Available insight sets" list.

insightName.description: The name of the Insight you want more information on. For example: "DocumentLatency" or "LCPBreakdown"

tools.name: performance_start_trace
tools.description: Starts a performance trace recording on the selected page. This can be used to look for performance problems and insights to improve the performance of the page. It will also report Core Web Vital (CWV) scores for the page.

reload.description: Determines if, once tracing has started, the page should be automatically reloaded.

autoStop.description: Determines if the trace recording should be automatically stopped.

tools.name: performance_stop_trace
tools.description: Stops the active performance trace recording on the selected page.

tools.name: press_key
tools.description: Press a key or key combination. Use this when other input methods like fill() cannot be used (e.g., keyboard shortcuts, navigation keys, or special key combinations).

key.description: A key or a combination (e.g., "Enter", "Control+A", "Control++", "Control+Shift+R"). Modifiers: Control, Shift, Alt, Meta

tools.name: resize_page
tools.description: Resizes the selected page's window so that the page has specified dimension

tools.name: select_page
tools.description: Select a page as a context for future tool calls.

pageIdx.description: The index of the page to select. Call list_pages to list pages.

tools.name: take_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the page or element.

format.description: Type of format to save the screenshot as. Default is "png"

quality.description: Compression quality for JPEG and WebP formats (0-100). Higher values mean better quality but larger file sizes. Ignored for PNG format.

uid.description: The uid of an element on the page from the page content snapshot. If omitted takes a pages screenshot.

fullPage.description: If set to true takes a screenshot of the full page instead of the currently visible viewport. Incompatible with uid.

filePath.description: The absolute path, or a path relative to the current working directory, to save the screenshot to instead of attaching it to the response.

tools.name: take_snapshot
tools.description:
Take a text snapshot of the currently selected page based on the a11y tree. The snapshot lists page elements along with a unique
identifier (uid). Always use the latest snapshot. Prefer taking a snapshot over taking a screenshot. The snapshot indicates the element selected
in the DevTools Elements panel (if any).

verbose.description: Whether to include all possible information available in the full a11y tree. Default is false.

filePath.description: The absolute path, or a path relative to the current working directory, to save the snapshot to instead of attaching it to the response.

tools.name: upload_file
tools.description: Upload a file through a provided element.

uid.description: The uid of the file input element or an element that will open file chooser on the page from the page content snapshot

filePath.description: The local path of the file to upload

tools.name: wait_for
tools.description: Wait for the specified text to appear on the selected page.

text.description: Text to appear on the page

timeout.description: Maximum wait time in milliseconds. If set to 0, the default timeout will be used.

container.description: Microsoft's Copilot Container Tools MCP implementation for VS Code Container Tools Extension

tools.name: act_container
tools.description: Start, stop, restart or remove a container by name or ID

action.description: The action to perform on the container

tools.name: act_image
tools.description: Pull or remove a container image by name or ID

imageNameOrId.description: The container image name or ID

action.description: The action to perform on the container image

tools.name: inspect_container
tools.description: Inspect a container by name or ID

tools.name: inspect_image
tools.description: Inspect a container image by name or ID

imageNameOrId.description: The container image name or ID

tools.name: list_containers
tools.description: List containers, including stopped ones

tools.name: list_images
tools.description: List container images, including untagged and orphaned ones

tools.name: list_networks
tools.description: List container networks

tools.name: list_volumes
tools.description: List container volumes

tools.name: logs_for_container
tools.description: View logs for a container by name or ID

tools.name: prune
tools.description: Prune unused container resources

pruneTarget.description: The type of resource to prune

tools.name: run_container
tools.description: Run a new container

image.description: The image to start the container from

environmentVariables.description: Environment variables to set in the container

publishAllPorts.description: Publish all exposed ports to random ports on the host interfaces. For containers that host a web service, this should usually be true.

interactive.description: Whether to run the container in interactively

hostPort.description: The port on the host machine to bind to the container port

protocol.description: The protocol to use for the port binding

mounts.description: Bind and volume mounts for the container

network.description: The name of the container network to connect the container to

tools.name: tag_image
tools.description: Tag a container image with a new tag

imageNameOrId.description: The container image name or ID

tag.description: The tag to apply to the container image
